intro: Guioa fuscidula var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved guioa, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and elliptical, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that are followed by spherical, fleshy fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
